Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Level 1

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Applied Culinary Techniques II
Description: Description: This practical learning lab provides the student with the opportunity to enhance his/her individual culinary techniques, methods of food preparation and presentation.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Applied Baking Techniques
Description: Description: This course building builds on skills learned in Applied Baking Techniques I. Students will focus on more advanced baking and pastry arts techniques by preparing fillings, decorations, petit fours, souffles and hot desserts , custards, contemporary plating techniques, ice creams and more….Hours: 45Credits: 2Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Culinary Theory II
Description: Description: Students will increase their knowledge of the theory of cookery through the study of foods and more complex cooking and preparation methods which are utilized in the production of the menus for our working dining roomHours: 45Credits: 3Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Advanced Kitchen Management-Cook
Description: Description: Students will be provided the financial foundation for the ongoing learning process of today's kitchen supervisors and managers.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Advanced Garde Manger
Description: Description: This practical course provides the opportunity for the student to enhance their culinary techniques and develop an appreciation of modern and traditional cooking skills by planning, preparing and presenting project related menus.

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: International Cuisine
Description: Description: This course examines the diverse forms of cuisine within society. Students will develop an appreciation and understanding of the factors that influence regional cuisines and their interaction in a global community. The material will be enhanced by various guest demonstrations presented through the cooperation of representatives of different ethnic backgrounds. Hours: 75Credits: 4Pre-Requisites: CoRequisites:

Institution: Conestoga College Institute of Technology and Advanced Learning
Name: Wine and Food Pairing
Description: Description: This introductory wine course will explore the major international grape varieties and wine regions of the world including Canada.
